column4: I'm trying to install Ubuntu on my '486 laptop. Again. The latest (intrepid) boot image crashes hard. Dapper and Edgy both worked, but not Gutsy. Should I try Hardy or just go with Dapper and upgrade?
ubuntu isn't meant to run on 486 hardware, it's too old. you might have better luck with xubuntu or elivecd
Absolute minimum on system requirements says 486 with 32MB RAM... I have 36 :)
where are you getting this information?
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation/SystemRequirements#Absolute%20minimum%20installation
However, installation may be extremely difficult and Ubuntu is likely to run very slowly on such a system.
Oh it's slow alright. Gnome in 320x200 isn't fun (or usable) either, but I want to install it anyway. Even just text mode would be fine.
in that case, you might as well install ubuntu server
Is there a different netboot image for server?
probably.
url?
